Analytical Chemistry: The science of chemical measurement, separation, instrumentation, and data analysis.
Chemical Biology: The application of chemical techniques, tools, and molecules to study and manipulate biological systems.
Inorganic Chemistry: The study of the synthesis, structure, and properties of inorganic and organometallic compounds, including catalysis and materials.
Materials Chemistry: The design, synthesis, and characterization of new functional materials, including polymers and nanomaterials.
Organic Chemistry: The study of the structure, properties, reactions, and synthesis of carbon-containing compounds.
Physical Chemistry: The study of chemical phenomena using the principles of physics, including spectroscopy, dynamics, and quantum mechanics.
Theoretical & Computational Chemistry: The use of computer simulation and mathematical models to understand and predict chemical behavior.
